item.title: 澳大利亚财报季考验银行股的避风港标签
item.description: 澳大利亚银行股是投资者应对关税引发的波动的相对避风港，随着贷款机构从下周开始公布盈利，银行股面临新的考验。【原文：Australia’s banking shares, a relative haven for investors dealing with tariff-induced volatility, face a fresh test as lenders unveil earnings starting next week.】

item.title: 美国联邦雇员申请失业救济人数在飙升后有所下降
item.description: 在特朗普政府开始解雇各机构工作人员时，联邦雇员新提交的失业救济申请曾出现过短暂的飙升，但在过去五周内，申请人数基本持平。【原文：New applications for unemployment benefits filed by federal employees have been largely flat in the past five weeks after a brief spike when the Trump administration started to fire workers across agencies.】

item.title: 美国中央情报局通过社交媒体招募中国官员
item.description: 美国中央情报局周四发布了两段视频，旨在招募可能对政府前景感到失望的中国官员，让他们与美国分享有关中国的最高机密。【原文：The Central Intelligence Agency released two videos Thursday aimed at recruiting Chinese officials who might be disillusioned by their prospects in government in a bid to get them to share top secrets about China with the US.】

item.title: 库克称苹果将从美国工厂采购 190 亿颗芯片
item.description: 苹果公司（Apple Inc.首席执行官蒂姆-库克（Tim Cook）表示，该公司正计划从美国采购超过 190 亿个芯片，用于其设备。【原文：Apple Inc. Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook said the company is planning to source more than 19 billion chips from the US for its devices.】

item.title: 苹果公司销售额将增长 "低至中个位数 "百分比
item.description: 苹果公司表示，预计当期营收将比去年同期增长 "低至中个位数"。【原文：Apple Inc. said it expects revenue in the current period to grow in the “low- to mid-single digit” percentage range from a year earlier.】

item.title: 苹果公司称关税将使本季度成本增加 9 亿美元
item.description: 苹果公司（Apple Inc.首席执行官蒂姆-库克（Tim Cook）表示，美国计划对外国进口商品征收的关税将在本期增加 9 亿美元的成本。【原文：Apple Inc. Chief Executive Officer Tim Cook said that planned US tariffs on foreign imports will add $900 million in costs in the current period.】

item.title: 美联储银行储备降至 3 万亿美元，为 1 月 1 日以来最低
item.description: 作为美联储决定继续缩减资产负债表的一个关键因素，美国银行系统的储备金跌至近四个月来的最低点。【原文：The US banking system’s reserves, a key factor in the Federal Reserve’s decision to keep shrinking its balance sheet, tumbled to the lowest in nearly four months.】

item.title: Cboe 任命前 CME 领导 Craig Donohue 为下任首席执行官
item.description: Cboe 全球市场公司（Cboe Global Markets Inc.）任命其竞争对手的前领导人克雷格-多诺霍（Craig Donohue）为最大的衍生品交易所之一的首席执行官。【原文：Cboe Global Markets Inc. tapped its rival’s former leader, Craig Donohue, to become chief executive officer of one of the largest derivatives exchanges.】

item.title: CN 铁路公司不畏关税阴霾，保持 2025 年增长展望
item.description: 加拿大国家铁路公司（Canadian National Railway Co.【原文：Shares of Canadian National Railway Co. ticked higher after the company beat analysts’ estimates and said it’s keeping its financial outlook for 2025 intact, despite rising economic risks.】

item.title: 佛罗里达州移民突击行动创纪录，逮捕 1,120 人
item.description: 上周，联邦移民局特工与州和地方当局合作，在佛罗里达州各地逮捕了 1120 人，官方称这是该州有史以来最大规模的移民执法协调行动。【原文：Federal immigration agents working with state and local authorities arrested 1,120 people across Florida last week in what officials called the largest coordinated immigration enforcement operation ever conducted in the state.】

item.title: 惠而浦因收入压力被 S&P 下调评级至 "垃圾 "级
item.description: 惠而浦公司（KitchenAid 和 Maytag 品牌的所有者）被 S&P Global Ratings 评为垃圾级，理由是该公司的债务水平较高，而且随着关税的增加，可能对收入造成压力。【原文：Whirlpool Corp., the owner of the KitchenAid and Maytag brands, was cut to junk status by S&P Global Ratings, which cited the company’s high debt levels and potential pressure on revenue as tariffs ramp up.】

item.title: JAB 以 25 亿美元收购 Keurig Dr Pepper 的部分股份
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，JAB Holding Co. 正寻求通过出售 Keurig Dr Pepper Inc.【原文：JAB Holding Co. is seeking to raise as much as $2.5 billion from the sale of Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. shares, according to people familiar with the matter, as it continues to sell down its holdings of the beverage company.】

item.title: 哈罗德百货是最新一家与黑客攻击作斗争的英国零售商
item.description: 伦敦奢侈品百货公司哈罗德（Harrods Ltd.）周四报告了黑客攻击企图，而就在几天前，英国另外两家零售商也表示遭到了攻击。【原文：London’s luxury department store Harrods Ltd. reported hacking attempts Thursday, just days after two other UK retailers said they were attacked.】

item.title: 华盛顿特区加快出售 15 亿美元债务，在需求推动下降低收益率
item.description: 哥伦比亚特区将 15 亿美元市政债券的销售时间提前了一天，这是因为美国州债和地方债的反弹刺激了对市政债券的需求。【原文：The District of Columbia accelerated the sale of $1.5 billion of municipal bonds by a day, taking advantage of a rally in US state and local debt that helped buoy demand for the securities.】

item.title: 苹果中国销售额不及预期，影响最新财报
item.description: 苹果公司最近一个季度在中国的销售额降幅超过预期，给这家 iPhone 制造商原本稳健的业绩蒙上了阴影。【原文：Apple Inc.’s sales from China declined more than anticipated in the latest quarter, overshadowing otherwise solid results for the iPhone maker.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚总统彼得罗提出将《劳动法》提交全民公决的议案
item.description: 哥伦比亚总统古斯塔沃-彼得罗（Gustavo Petro）周四提交了一项法案，旨在将有关劳工权利和工作条件的提案提交全民公决，因为国会今年早些时候否决了他的劳工改革提案。【原文：Colombian President Gustavo Petro presented a bill on Thursday that seeks to submit proposals for labor rights and working conditions to a public referendum after Congress rejected his labor reform earlier this year.】

item.title: 港口领导人警告关税给经济带来 "根本性的不确定性
item.description: 美国西海岸主要港口的领导人警告说，唐纳德-特朗普总统对中国商品征收的巨额关税导致船舶运输量急剧下降，这将威胁到就业、抬高物价，并波及更广泛的美国经济。【原文：Leaders of major West Coast ports warned that a sharp drop in ship traffic tied to President Donald Trump’s steep tariffs on Chinese goods will threaten jobs, raise prices and ripple through the broader US economy.】

item.title: 亚马逊预计利润因贸易担忧不及预期
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）对本季度营业利润的预测低于预期，指出关税和贸易政策可能导致消费者减少支出。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. gave a weaker-than-expected forecast for operating profit in the current quarter, pointing toward tariffs and trade policies that may cause consumers to pull back on spending.】

item.title: 战略公司亏损创纪录，将出售 210 亿美元股票
item.description: 迈克尔-赛勒（Michael Saylor）的 "战略 "公司（Strategy）第一季度出现了创纪录的 42 亿美元亏损，因为该公司采用了一项会计变更，要求按照市场价格对其持有的大量比特币进行估值。此外，该公司还计划再出售 210 亿美元的普通股，为购买更多加密货币提供资金。【原文：Michael Saylor’s Strategy registered a record $4.2 billion first-quarter loss after adopting an accounting change that requires valuing the firm’s massive Bitcoin holdings at market prices. And also registered to sell another $21 billion in common shares to finance more purchases of the cryptocurrency.】

item.title: 支付公司下调盈利预期后，布洛克股票下跌
item.description: 杰克-多西（Jack Dorsey）领导的数字支付公司布洛克公司（Block Inc.【原文：Block Inc., the digital-payments company led by Jack Dorsey, posted first-quarter results below analysts’ estimates and lowered its full-year profit guidance as a result of a more challenging macroeconomic environment.】

item.title: Reddit 公布收入超过分析师预期后大涨
item.description: Reddit 公司表示，本季度营收将好于预期，这表明经济下滑尚未影响数字广告业的发展，Reddit 公司股价随之大涨。【原文：Reddit Inc. shares jumped after it said revenue in the current quarter will be better than estimates, a sign that a broader dip in the economy hasn’t yet dented the digital advertising industry.】

item.title: Instacart 订单增长创 2022 年以来新高，前景一片光明
item.description: Instacart 公布了自 2022 年以来第一季度最强劲的订单增长，并预计当期盈利将好于预期，这表明其核心配送业务和不断增长的杂货软件和广告部门具有恢复力。【原文：Instacart posted its strongest order growth since 2022 for the first quarter and projected better-than-expected earnings for the current period, a sign of resilience in its core delivery business and growing grocery software and advertising unit.】

item.title: Airbnb 以美国旅游需求疲软为由展望未来
item.description: Airbnb Inc.发布的第二季度业绩展望疲软，继在线旅游同行Booking Holdings Inc.之后，将美国旅游需求疲软归咎于经济不确定性。【原文：Airbnb Inc. issued a weak outlook for the second quarter, following online travel peer Booking Holdings Inc. in blaming economic uncertainties for softer travel demand in the US.】

item.title: 60 分钟 "将播出特朗普针对律师事务所的报道
item.description: 就在唐纳德-特朗普总统批评《60 分钟》的批评性报道太多之后不到三周，该新闻杂志宣布计划播出一篇关于他通过行政命令打击律师事务所的报道。【原文：Less than three weeks after President Donald Trump criticized 60 Minutes for what he said were too many critical stories, the newsmagazine announced plans to air a piece about his efforts to target law firms through executive orders.】

item.title: 人工智能推动顶级用户数量增长，Duolingo 前景看好
item.description: Duolingo Inc.上调了全年销售额和利润展望，原因是人工智能产品促使用户购买其价格更高的订阅服务。【原文：Duolingo Inc. raised its full-year sales and profit outlook as artificial intelligence offerings are driving users to its higher-priced subscriptions.】

item.title: 人工智能聊天机器人说出你想听的话的危险
item.description: OpenAI 正在采取措施，让 ChatGPT 不再那么谄媚，尽管这个问题可能很难彻底解决。但首先...【原文：OpenAI is taking steps to make ChatGPT less sycophantic, though the problem may be tough to solve completely. But first...】

item.title: AQR长短仓策略四月收益将2025年回报率提升至12.1
item.description: AQR 资本管理公司（AQR Capital Management）的德尔福股票多空策略（Delphi Long-Short Equity Strategy）在第一季度的表现优于许多其他以股票为重点的对冲基金，4 月份跃升 3.2%。【原文：AQR Capital Management’s Delphi Long-Short Equity Strategy jumped 3.2% in April, after outperforming many other stock-focused hedge funds in the first quarter.】

item.title: 比特币突破 10 周高点后逼近 100,000 美元
item.description: 比特币在达到 2 月下旬以来的最高水平后，再次快速逼近 10 万美元，整个金融市场重新点燃了投资者的风险偏好。【原文：Bitcoin is fast approaching $100,000 once again, after reaching its highest level since late February, with investors’ appetite for risk being rekindled across financial markets.】

item.title: 与嘉能可的潜在交易失败后，锂电池寻求买家
item.description: 在与嘉能可集团（Glencore Plc）的潜在交易告吹后，一家加拿大电池回收初创企业正在寻找买家。【原文：A Canadian battery recycling startup is seeking buyers after a potential sale to Glencore Plc fell through.】

item.title: 光速公司是摆脱传统风险投资模式的最新公司
item.description: 光速创投（Lightspeed Venture Partners）是硅谷最大的风险投资公司之一，该公司已改变其监管地位，以扩大其投资范围；红杉资本（Sequoia Capital）、安德森-霍洛维茨公司（Andreessen Horowitz）和通用催化剂公司（General Catalyst）也采取了类似举措，摆脱了传统风险投资的玩法。【原文：Lightspeed Venture Partners, one of Silicon Valley’s largest venture capital firms, has changed its regulatory status to broaden its range of investments — following similar moves by Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz and General Catalyst as they shift away from the traditional VC playbook.】
